intro: Sericocalyx sublaevis, commonly known as the smooth-leafed sericocalyx, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species with ornamental and medicinal value. The plant is characterized by its smooth, waxy leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
